channel.title: Haiti earthquake
channel.description:
[img]http://newsimg.bbc.co.uk/media/images/47102000/gif/_47102542_haiti_quake466x412.gif[/img]
Haitian President Rene Preval has said thousands of people are feared dead following a huge quake which has devastated the country's capital.
sauce: [code]http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/8456819.stm[/code] Not really a big deal since most of them are drug abusing, impoverished niggers.

item.title: Haiti earthquake
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:53, topic:325789”][quote author=akl link=topic=422201.msg3102883#msg3102883 date=1263840742]

The US is the most generous country in the world.

Frell, I’m wondering if you’ve ever done any reading on financial aid provided my Highly Developed Countries to LDC. The aid provided by these rich countries has many strings attached to it, so no, USA is not the most generous country in the world.

[/quote]
We’ve been giving loads of stuff to Africa for a long time now, including laptops. And we also help the treatment of aids there.[/quote]
also with strings attached.
Pay back 1/3 of this, buy our supplies only, give us x% of you’re output etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Haiti earthquake
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

If the same thing happened to an arab country would America help…?

Actually, we would “help”, in return for oil.

Read full topic

item.title: Haiti earthquake
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:59, topic:325789”][quote author=inertia link=topic=422201.msg3103022#msg3103022 date=1263849911]

Just giving money isn’t what those people need. What do you want to achieve with that. Here mister Haiti, here’s $100m. Mr. Haiti: WHERE DO I SPEND THIS?!? You should send food, and people that can actually do something, not soldiers. The UN has it all sorted security wise.

Oh and $100m is dogshit compared to the money given to the financial sector. Besides, you can only buy a bit more then $11 worth of food per person for $100m. The Haitian government probably will use that money to repay some off it’s debts anyway.

They’re not sending money, they are sending stuff like food, water and blankets but there isn’t enough for everyone.

Support trucks keep getting attacked and once people actually get supplies they get attacked and looted, which is why they need the army there to attempt to keep the peace.
[/quote]

If they don’t send money, why do they say that they’ve sent $100m? Why do they put a moneytag on aide? “Hey, here’s the food and other stuff you really need. It has cost us a $100m!!”

I’m sorry, they almost had it right. But they fucked it up by saying what the US payed for it.

Oh, and the EU sends €420m, if you like to value everything in money.[/quote]

I don’t know, maybe the government thinks we’d rather know these stats in currency rather than 10,294 bottles of water and 5,235 egg sandwiches. As you say though, they probably just did it to show off how much money they’ve spent rather than the help they’re giving.

Whatever the reason is, they didn’t just fly over to Haiti and dump $100m on their doorstep.

Read full topic

Oh and $100m is dogshit compared to the money given to the financial sector. Besides, you can only buy a bit more then $11 worth of food per person for $100m. The Haitian government probably will use that money to repay some off it’s debts anyway.
[/quote]
They’re not sending money, they are sending stuff like food, water and blankets but there isn’t enough for everyone.

Support trucks keep getting attacked and once people actually get supplies they get attacked and looted, which is why they need the army there to attempt to keep the peace.[/quote]

If they don’t send money, why do they say that they’ve sent $100m? Why do they put a moneytag on aide? “Hey, here’s the food and other stuff you really need. It has cost us a $100m!!”

I’m sorry, they almost had it right. But they fucked it up by saying what the US payed for it.

Oh, and the EU sends €420m, if you like to value everything in money.

item.title: Haiti earthquake
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

US government donated $100M and Obama asked for the help of Bush and Clinton on the issue.

Through donation funds like text Haiti to 0990 or something we donated $10M

[quote=“goatee, post:40, topic:325789”]I love how the US is putting 10,000 troops there, just getting ready to intorduce a 51st state.

Also George Bush - “I know you want to send water and blankets, just send your cash … we’ll take care of it ;)”

Can’t believe some stupid fucking Americans are still letting him think he’s important.[/quote]
It cannot be a state, probably a territory like Guam and Bahamas etc.

[quote=“nacional, post:42, topic:325789”][quote author=goatee link=topic=422201.msg3100555#msg3100555 date=1263680056]
I love how the US is putting 10,000 troops there, just getting ready to intorduce a 51st state.

Also George Bush - “I know you want to send water and blankets, just send your cash … we’ll take care of it ;)”

Can’t believe some stupid fucking Americans are still letting him think he’s important.
[/quote]

Troops are there to stop rioting and if you seen any videos you know how hectic it is over there
they also sent a fleet of many medics. It actually looks like the USA is the only who cares or at
least shows effort. Where’s china and the european nations?

@unhandled you really think the current war is about oil?[/quote]
The US is the most generous country in the world.

That’s whole other topic. Please explain the riots in Haiti. I personally believe
they are rioting over how there is no supplies and all the looting.

What else would they be rioting about? Maternity leave?
[/quote]
Obvious so why are troops being sent over to control them being criticized?[/quote]
I think it’s something to do with them taking over the airports and rejecting care packages because they’re not from the US.

I’m not sure though, I just heard it briefly on the news.

@unhandled you really think the current war is about oil?[/quote]
If you wish to level roots with these aspects of the US war then perhaps consider why there are riots?
USA’s presence is not taken lightly by the people of Afghanistan. Hence they riot until they will get what they want. I truly feel for Afghanistan, it’s a nation that’s been torn by 2 powerful nations only for their personal gain. Leave Afghanistan and the Middle East and see how these “acts of terrorism” decrease. The image of Islam has been tainted by mediocre minds of Americans who do not quite understand concepts and facts.

item.title: Haiti earthquake
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

nacional:

You said as if you wanted it to stop right now.

I said, and I quote:

Unhandled:

why not start right now?

We need to start realizing that oil is going to disappear. If countries like Venezuela don’t want to sell the US oil for cheap, then they need to grow the fuck up and start figuring out how to use less of it.
